message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<Vertex> i = ograph.getVertices("SPECIAL-NODE", "SPECIAL").iterator();
if(i.hasNext()){
    System.out.println(i.next());
}
<<<explanation>>>: The method getVertexByKey() is not a valid method in the OrientDB API. Instead, you should use the getVertices() method to get an iterator over the vertices with the specified key and value, and then use the next() method to get the next vertex in the iteration. The hasNext() method is used to check if there is a next vertex in the iteration, which can prevent a NoSuchElementException if there is no next vertex.
